TextBlock.TextLine: I limited my opinion, yett the menagement is left to you onely I would
faine have all or most of the kersies first & some of thes fine northrens
I take noticie how you deale with yd correspondents in the north, which
is well, for tis mony onely that is the live of trade & gives in corrigement
yett, he that hath the commission for the 3 packes must, or ought not
to draw more then he doth disburse, for oneles he doth better then
mr. potter, he shall have no imploy: & I do supose that m. potter will do
well, though mr. chippinge did yett some what better, which itt may be
was because cloth was cheaper then, whoever faile not to used all yds
retoricall frases to oblige mr. potter in well proceeding
as for the laces I exspect Ben: klarck arrived & N.15 with you in saluo
from 4:6 to N. 17 is aboard Robert fox, which will saile pr first good wind N.16 is
5 sbayd raw
departed with Ed: Dover which I do not doubt butt is also well arrived
now N.18 is gon to newport, & of that is here in closed the in voyce
containing the rest & all what I have bought, or ordered for yd accompt
& doth containe N179 which is the peece you sent, to be made
& is long @l yd peece was so have payd 5¼ att ƒ9:15: you will not be
able to discover from which and itt is begon, for itt is rather better
then the patt. you sent I wish all safe to you hand & that itt might
be sold to content to in large take that trade for I hope these parcells
will prove well haveing don my endeavour so that purpose I hope
@ 12 July 81
teremitt you mony pr. neat &
th 3
London Henry Maynard
S. my last to you was on the 5: curitt with a remise of £100 on John
hillersd on, then I desired you also to take not ice that itt is yd & my intrest not
to send any goods upon what acc soever to any other in this towne which I supose
you will not do: amonghst others there is the servant of mad Bouwens
hath lett him self to one of our shop keepers with promise to make them
turne marchant, which perhaps, by yd & other assistance could come to
a beginning where fore I have accquainted you of what I iudge preudiciall
to our Comp. I have new recd. yd of 24th past, as yett I heare not one word
of thomas white yett I hope he might arrive att least, thought wee have
had much bad weather on our coast of late I have also no news of hasleward
& have given the necessary orders to mr. Coats about the packing press
for which have given you creditt, & could wish she stood here as those
with yd packers, & I hope you shall have persuaded the maker of our
to deliver 5 peeces pr. first, John kent hath engaged to take all from him
as I am told: butt yett i supose he will delivered some to you, which
ought to be here in a months time as soone as the auroras are ready
please to dispatch them with the reds & green, not do doubting butt
the green will be don as soone as the rest when all our in ordered
goods are over shall write for more: I have had in different good sale
this week where fore have had no time to send you acctt. of sale of
last month which though is made up, yett not drawne out which I doubt
not butt will answer yd exspectation mr Eaek hoven one of the
heires heires of mad. Bouwens is instituded & hath procuration of
the rest to menadge the concernes of the sterfhouse, & they have already
monyes enough in handes so that you may exspect the ballance of yd acctt
with the first intrim shall aso endeavour from my side to remittt
you to content as to the concernes of mr. peeters, I have sent him the
patt. & prises of first cost of the resting spanish cloathes, which
mr. slaughter must take back as best he can aggree, for they are not
to be sold here for ½ the valew haveing don as much I could to putt
y off so what shall come short shall be payd in mony & so to end
that affaires for & will be redd of them & discharge mr. slaughter
Bills as well as my self of what I sever have don for 2 him, beeng as
much desirous there unto as mr. slaughter him selfs or the mony which
is att present from
@ 12 July 81
London George Cole
Sr. have before mee yd of 27th past by which you advise mee that my remise
for acctt of I.V. was accepted. I will not question butt that the payement
will be accordingly att the latter end of this month & next our trade
comes in againe when I exspect that mony will come accordingly & hope
to cleare that acctt. pr. first intrim I wonder of what you say that
mr. Daniel vivian tells you he hath given him the £80: was & is
William Depeyster, the bill was made payable to Daniel busschop for
the valew of william depeyster which never had power or any procuration
to demand one penny yett lett mee intreat you to desire in Dan: vivia
that he shews either the first or second bill, or any the least accqu
given by said the peyster for acctt. of sid bill & then I know to
procure the valew for mr. Depeyster hath al wayes denyed over to have
receaved one forthingnay so much as to have wer discoursed about itt
itt is not for me butt for orphent of my brother in lawe, wher of or hope you
will excuse itt & endeavour that they gett their due
Brugge Raphael Coots
mijnsHr sedert mijnen van 11 deser de ul van 11 & 12 ditto bekomen geirne gesien
tarrivement van thomas white het pack N.° 20 als geseght, & de N 22 adroicture
verhope wable haele wouyt gearriveert is twelke geirneverneme tpack
gelieft adroiture te sende als mede de packperse dewelke anderael aen
ul seer recommandeere opdat geen scijven, boomen ofte iets sulx int ongeree
geraeke enderijsen niet gebroeken worden n
Amsterd De Hulter & van Homright
mess Door mijn absentie is den ul van 4 deser onbeantwoort gebleven, doch
Den selven is met brieven van 7 ditto eerst bestelt: sal met de boter ul ordre
trachte te don volgen & deroordoen die ten eersten te verkoopend: ben over
den bewuste makelerdij loon voldoen, dat ick sulx noteerde was om dies will mu
was geseijt dat de koopers den loon niet moesten betaelen: maer den verkoopers
en alsoo alles aen ul directie heb gereferveert wille daer over niet wijders repligueren
ick hebbe noch eenighe supra fijne segouische van doen: soo gelieft met occasie
te noteeren de gelegentheyt en prijs ul versoeght een goede correspondent tot Brugge
die de tersche ingotie verstaet: daer toe recommandeere de TA. Raphael
Coots een vande stuwfe & bequaemste oock preciefte van all, ende dengenen
wel en voor considerable somme te betrouwens due geve mijn pine
ul sal hem tot conten tement noch beter onder vinden raer mede blijve
Brussel Jouff Bonnecroy
jouff den ul van 2 deser hebbe ick ontfangen als mede de canten sal eerstdaen
aen ul volle satisfactie geven, ondertussche doet gereet maken een goede
soorteringe traillie werck & renise gront vandehooghde tot cravratte gelgk
denaet aen ul gegeven van 6 tot 12p delle maer sij moete vande hooghde
vande maet sijn oock een pertije tot manchetten, soo ul de precius moet
observeert & suijver wit werck doet maken & schoon goet soo sal wel
voor ƒ1000: van doen hebbe waer toe maer sƒo 23 a 14 tijt hebbe als wan
wel bij ul sal wesen soo gelieft u best te doen op dat ul mij wel kandien
waer op ul antwoort verwaghten
Brussel Joseph Sabberton
monsr. this onely to desire you to provide for mee a small parcell of laces
accordingly to the last in casures & instructions viz for plaine & luped ground
for Crawats & cuffs to the valew of about ƒ350 a ƒ400 butt they must
be curious goods & penni worths, so in case you meett with any pray keep
them for mee & lett mee have yd adaye hilst I remaine
if you lost my incasure shall send others up on yds advise
Brussel Joan Jacops
mons. ter leesten is tpack MN 20 met spaense lakens heden noch hier gearriv
neert soo gelieft mij te ordonneere wat daermede gelieft gedaen te hebben ofte
dat ick het selve is toesende ofte dat ul gelieft over te komen ben van alle
voor te van goederen wel versien verwaghte ul ordre n blijve
